Posts.Content: Started my Zytiga today, and I am feeling OK. I was, and am worried about all of the side effects listed. (too many, not to ignore) Previously been on lupron and bicalutamide, but it stopped its effectiveness. I am really lucky to be approved for this treatment, as I am uninsured. I feel great, as long as I treat my pain. Does anyone here have any suggestions or tips for me. Thanks, and have a nice weekend. Bobbie. Oh and prednisone also started. I never had any drugs prior to pc
Posts.Title: Just started Zytiga.

Posts.Content: Thanks Fairwind. Age 46, gleason 8, psa 50. They dropped the bicalutamide and lupron, and started Zometa for bone mets. Funny, my 1st doctor just thought i was trying to get pain pills to get high on LOL . So far just a little nausea from the Zytiga or maybe the Predsinone. I'm still having a hard time getting my brothers to get psa test. I wish I would have, earlier.
Posts.Title: Just started Zytiga.

Posts.Content: Is the prostate ever removed, in a case where cancer has matasticised, and there is pain caused by tumor? This is my situation. Doc suspects that increase in psa is caused by tumor growth, and not by bone involvement etc. psa jumped from 12 to 30 in 4 mos.
Posts.Title: Prostate removal question.

Posts.Content: Sorry, I should have given more info. I am 46 ys. old and 2 years ago, was diagnosed with stage 4, gleason grade 8, metastatic prostate cancer to the ribs. psa was 300, and was put on Lupron and Casodex (Casodex was stopped after 4 mos. ) treatment brought psa down to I think around 4. I lost my insurance, went broke and stopped treatment. but luckily, was able to continue treatment at a new hospital. psa was at 12, but came down to 6, after lupron injection. Recently I started having prostate pain, and nausea. Doc sent me in for mri and bone scans (both came back good) Doc said prostate looked lumpy, and thinks prostate tumor is causing psa increase, so he started me on Casodex (yuck), in hopes that it will bring psa down. I was just wondering if prostate is ever removed, when tumor growth etc. causes pain, or urinary restriction etc.
Posts.Title: Prostate removal question.

Posts.Content: Tell me about it. I was probably out of pocket around $30,000.00 the first year, and I had 80/20 insurance, w/ a $2,000.00 deductible. Lost my insurance because couldn't afford insurance, and treatment. It was eat or die. luckily, I am native American, and my tribe is helping me. I wasn't eligible for any state help because i am single w/ no kids, and still able to work. Consider yourself lucky if you have treatment, and a place to live. I remember paying $700.00 for HDT injections, every 3 mos. due at time of treatment. Imagine how my doctor felt, when I had to stop treatments. (Original PSA was 300, but knocked down to 12 w/ HDT injections) 45 years old.
